title: How to Add Swatches in Adobe Photoshop

steps.title: Go to "Windows" in the top menu.
steps.content: Go to "Windows" in the top menu.

steps.title: Select "Swatches" from the Windows menu.
steps.content: Select "Swatches" from the Windows menu. This will open the Swatches palette in a pop-up window. There will be some predefined colors already in the Swatches palette.

steps.title: Delete any swatches that you don't want in the Swatches palette.
steps.content: Delete any swatches that you don't want in the Swatches palette. You can do this by clicking on the swatch, dragging it to the bottom-right of the palette window and dropping it into the trash can icon.

steps.title: Click on the foreground color in the Photoshop toolbar (the foreground color appears at the bottom of the toolbar in a small square just above the background color).
steps.content: Click on the foreground color in the Photoshop toolbar (the foreground color appears at the bottom of the toolbar in a small square just above the background color).

steps.title: Create a new foreground color by moving your mouse over the color chart that appears in the Color Picker window and clicking on the color that you want.
steps.content: Create a new foreground color by moving your mouse over the color chart that appears in the Color Picker window and clicking on the color that you want. You can move the arrows on the hues chart to change the hues in the color chart. If you have been provided specific information about the color such as its RGB (red, green and blue) or CMYK (cyan, magenta, yellow and black) values then you can enter those values in the numeric boxes to create the exact color that is required.

steps.title: Press the "Add to Swatches" button on the Color Picker window.
steps.content: Press the "Add to Swatches" button on the Color Picker window. This will add the custom color that you have created as a new swatch in the Swatches palette.

steps.title: Repeat the process to create and add as many custom swatches as you want.
steps.content: Repeat the process to create and add as many custom swatches as you want.

steps.title: View the dropdown menu on the Swatches palette by clicking on the arrow pointing down on the top-right corner of the palette window.
steps.content: View the dropdown menu on the Swatches palette by clicking on the arrow pointing down on the top-right corner of the palette window.

steps.title: Select "Save Swatches" from the dropdown menu.
steps.content: Select "Save Swatches" from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Name your new swatches file and press the "Save" button to save it.
steps.content: Name your new swatches file and press the "Save" button to save it. You should not change the default location where the file is saved, but just save it in the Color Swatches folder that Photoshop brings up when you try to save new swatch palettes.

steps.title: Load a saved swatches palette if you want to reuse it.
steps.content: Load a saved swatches palette if you want to reuse it. This task is particularly useful if you add swatches in Photoshop frequently when working on different documents and some documents need to follow the same color formula. Here is what you need to do.

steps.title: Open the Swatches palette like you usually do (go to "Window" and then select "Swatches").
steps.content: Open the Swatches palette like you usually do (go to "Window" and then select "Swatches").

steps.title: Click on the arrow pointing down in the top-right corner and select "Load Swatches."
steps.content: Click on the arrow pointing down in the top-right corner and select "Load Swatches."

steps.title: Choose the swatch palette that you want to load from the list of saved swatches that appears.
steps.content: Choose the swatch palette that you want to load from the list of saved swatches that appears.
